fields: "Specifically for {{c11::{{c5::sexual}} {{c6::desire}}}}, {{c12::{{c8::{{c2::focus}} more}} on the {{c7::energy}} and {{c9::actually {{c1::open}}}} to it}}, {{c13::{{c4::allow}} that {{c10::actual {{c7::energy}}}} in the {{c3::space}} of the {{c9::energy body}}}}"
(burbea jhana retreat)
"Those things that make {{c1::jhana}} {{c2::seductive}} are what make {{c3::samsara}} {{c2::seductive}} if you look {{c4::closely}} enough."
(shargrol compilation)
"All of the {{c1::jhanas}} have {{c5::allure}} because there is a {{c4::kind of {{c2::false {{c3::refuge}}}}}} that seems {{c6::possible}}."
(shargrol compilation)

If we {{c1::force}} the {{c2::mind}} to be {{c3::mindful}}, it's a {{c4::matter}} of {{c5::will}}. If we {{c6::learn}} to {{c7::prefer}} {{c8::mindfulness}}, then it becomes {{c9::natural}} and {{c10::easy}}.

"Gravitating towards the sensations of breathing is a great way to say it. By using less and less effort, yet also being willing to start again once we get lost in trance, we learn to prefer mindfulness naturally. If we force the mind to be mindful, it's a matter of will. If we learn to prefer mindfulness, then it becomes natural and easy."
{{c5::Earth}}: behind {{c1::greed}}/{{c4::defending our position}} is {{c2::insecurity}}, if you can be with {{c2::insecurity}} it becomes {{c3::generosity}}
(from McLeod's 5 elements)
{{c5::Water}}: behind {{c1::anger}}/{{c2::avoidance}}/{{c5::pushing away}} is {{c3::fear}}, if you can be with {{c3::fear}} it becomes {{c4::clarity}}
(from McLeod's 5 elements)
{{c6::Fire}}: behind {{c7::neediness}}/{{c3::becoming {{c4::obsessed}} with {{c5::details}}}} is {{c1::isolation}}, if you can be with {{c1::isolation}} it becomes {{c2::compassion}}
(from McLeod's 5 elements)
{{c5::Air}}: behind {{c1::hyperactivity}}/{{c2::suspiciousness}}/{{c5::paranoia}} is {{c3::anxiety}}, if you can be with {{c3::anxiety}} it becomes {{c4::effective action}}
(from McLeod's 5 elements)
{{c4::Space}}: behind {{c1::depression}} is {{c2::confusion}}, if you can be with {{c2::confusion}} it becomes {{c3::panoramic awareness}}
(from McLeod's 5 elements)

- [[oc11::Mudita]], [[oc12::spiritual joy]]

Shargrol's 6 levels scaffolding guideline. I thinking along the lines of structuring the day as traditional sit/walk... and as a practice, using a basic scaffolding/heirarchy:

1. {{c20::{{c2::noticing}} {{c1::experience}} as it is }}
2. {{c21::when 1 is not possible, {{c2::noticing}} {{c26::{{c5::attraction}}, {{c6::repulsion}}, {{c7::neutralness}}}} as it is}}
3. {{c22::when 2 is not possible, {{c2::noticing}} {{c27::{{c8::greed}}, {{c9::aversion}}, {{c10::indifference}}}}}}
4. {{c23::when 3 is not possible, {{c4::noting}} {{c27::{{c8::greed}}, {{c9::aversion}}, {{c10::indifference}}}}}}
5. {{c24::when 4 is not possible, {{c4::noting}} {{c28::{{c11::sensations}}, {{c12::urges}}, {{c13::emotions}}, or {{c14::thoughts}}}}}}
6. {{c25::when 5 is not possible, {{c4::noting}} {{c29::{{c15::6 realms}} or some other {{c16::{{c19::big categories}} of {{c17::psychological}} {{c18::views}}}}}}}}
(from shargol's posts compilation)
(shargrol compilation)

"A {{c1::dark night}} yogi kinda {{c2::{{c3::secretly}} wants to have {{c6::all}} the {{c4::bad stuff}} {{c5::beaten out of him/her}}}}. A {{c1::dark night}} yogi often is {{c11::{{c7::intimidated}} by {{c8::love}}, {{c9::healing}}, and {{c10::joy}}}}. Use this {{c12::retreat}} to {{c13::drop the {{c14::masochism}} and {{c15::build new {{c16::habits}}}}}}."
(shargrol compilation)

"My recommendation is if {{c1::noting}} that {{c2::fast}} makes you {{c3::neurotic}}, {{c4::manic}}, {{c5::speedy}}, etc, then try to {{c6::notice}} the {{c7::urge}} that is {{c8::driving you}}. Chances are it is some kind of {{c9::greediness}} (maybe for {{c10::progress}}), {{c11::aversion}} (maybe to {{c12::some {{c13::sensation}} or {{c14::thought}} that is {{c15::occuring}}, which you are trying to {{c17::cover up}} by {{c16::noting}} other things}}), or {{c18::ignorance}}"
(shargrol compilation)

"When {{c1::noting}} becomes {{c4::difficult}} -- this is {{c13::{{c15::very}} {{c14::important}}}} -- {{c1::note}} what is actually {{c3::causing}} the {{c4::difficulty}}. {{c1::Note}} {{c5::pain}}, {{c6::discomfort}}, {{c7::frustration}}, {{c8::confusion}}, {{c9::dullness}}, {{c10::controlling}}, {{c11::manipulation}}, {{c12::effort}}, etc."
(shargrol compilation)

"The
 whole point of retreat is to let the {{c1::mind}} do what it {{c2::does}} and {{c3::notice}} 
that {{c4::it all {{c7::comes back}} to the {{c5::{{c6::present}} moment}}}}. And when you are {{c8::back}} to 
the {{c9::present moment}}, you {{c10::notice}} that there is a {{c11::simplicity}} and {{c12::calmness}} 
and {{c13::easiness}} that is {{c14::available}} if we just {{c15::let ourselves {{c16::let go of 
{{c17::clinging}}}}}} and just sit, just walk, just eat, just shower/bathe, just 
sleep, just shit, just pee, just burp."
(shargrol compilation)

"when
 we actually {{c5::stop}} {{c6::making things difficult}}, all the nanas {{c1::{{c4::{{c21::come}} and {{c22::go}}}} by {{c3::themselves}}}}. {{c7::You {{c9::don't}} need to make}} nanas or jhanas or paths {{c8::happen}}. They
 {{c10::occur}} {{c11::on their own}}. {{c12::{{c16::Forcing}} it}} or {{c13::{{c15::craving}} {{c14::faster progress}}}} will {{c17::almost 
guarantee}} {{c18::suffering}}, {{c19::exhaustion}}, and {{c20::burn out}}."
(shargrol compilation)

"Remember {{c1::SE/fruition}} {{c2::just {{c3::happens}}}}, so {{c4::effort}} is needed at times to {{c5::stay on retreat}} and {{c6::keep doing simple practices}} ({{c7::which seem {{c8::boring}} to the {{c9::discursive}} {{c10::mind}}}}), but {{c4::effort}} is not needed to {{c11::make {{c13::experience}} {{c14::happen}}}} and {{c4::effort}} is not needed to {{c12::be aware}}."
(shargrol compilation)

Nature of Problem: {{c10::Concrete/Operational}}
Practice: {{c11::Normal {{c1::life}}, normal {{c2::skill development}}}}
Event(s): {{c12::{{c3::Psychological}} insights, {{c4::A&P type}} mystical insight}}
Major Wisdom: {{c13::{{c5::Perception of world}} isn't "real", {{c6::problems may not be real}}}}
(from https://web.archive.org/web/20201111225017/http://awakenetwork.org/magazine/shargrol/253)

Nature of Problem: {{c14::Bodily}}
Practice: {{c15::Meditative {{c1::movement}} – {{c2::yoga}}, {{c3::weights}}, {{c4::chi kung}}, {{c5::martial arts "forms"}}}}
Event(s): {{c16::{{c6::Psychological}} insights, {{c7::A&P type}} mystical {{c8::awakening}}}}
Major Wisdom: {{c17::{{c9::Mind and body related}}, {{c10::subtle body is mind}}}}
(from https://web.archive.org/web/20201111225017/http://awakenetwork.org/magazine/shargrol/253)

Nature of Problem: {{c14::Personal}}
Practice: {{c15::{{c1::Therapeutic}} "{{c2::listening}}" meditation, the {{c3::bubbling-up}} of {{c4::personal thoughts}}}}
Event(s): {{c16::{{c5::Psychological}} insights, {{c6::A&P type}} mystical insight}}
Major Wisdom: {{c17::{{c7::Flavors of}} {{c8::reactivity and neurosis}} {{c9::limits self-expression}}, {{c10::relaxed mind is best}}}}
(from https://web.archive.org/web/20201111225017/http://awakenetwork.org/magazine/shargrol/253)

Nature of Problem: {{c14::Authority, Self-Will}}
Practice: {{c15::{{c1::Fenner's}} {{c2::Natural Release}}/ {{c3::Relaxation meditation}}}}
Event(s): {{c16::{{c4::Glimpse of Presence}}}}
Major Wisdom: {{c17::{{c5::Basic self worth}} and {{c6::self trust}}}}
(from https://web.archive.org/web/20201111225017/http://awakenetwork.org/magazine/shargrol/253)

Nature of Problem: {{c14::Solid Time}}
Practice: {{c15::{{c1::Biocognition}}, {{c2::Past}}/{{c3::present}}/{{c4::future}} {{c5::Thought}}/{{c6::body}}}}
Event(s): {{c16::Insights into {{c7::shame}}, {{c8::betrayal}}, {{c9::abandonment}}}}
Major Wisdom: {{c17::{{c10::Past is pride and shame}}, {{c11::honor includes both}}.{{c12::Future is hope and fear of betrayal}}, {{c13::faithfulness includes both}}.{{c14::Present is self-presence and fear of abandonment}}, {{c15::commitment includes both}} – we can meaningfully "lose ourselves" as presence}}
(from https://web.archive.org/web/20201111225017/http://awakenetwork.org/magazine/shargrol/253)

Nature of Problem: {{c14::Impersonal Reality – "It" realm}}
Practice: {{c15::{{c1::Insight Meditation}}, the {{c2::bubbling up}} of {{c3::impersonal states}}}}
Event(s): {{c16::{{c4::Nanas}}, {{c5::Jhanas}}, {{c6::Cessations}}}}
Major Wisdom: {{c17::{{c7::No control}} of {{c8::mindstates}}}}
(from https://web.archive.org/web/20201111225017/http://awakenetwork.org/magazine/shargrol/253)

Nature of Problem: {{c14::Contextual Reality – "we" realm}}
Practice: {{c15::{{c1::Surrender}} – {{c2::6 realms paradigm}} is helpful}}
Event(s): {{c16::{{c4::Nibbana}} – {{c5::ending of mindstate}}}}
Major Wisdom: {{c17::{{c6::Dependent Origination}} and {{c7::"gone"}}}}
(from https://web.archive.org/web/20201111225017/http://awakenetwork.org/magazine/shargrol/253)

Nature of Problem: {{c14::Uncontrollable, elemental reactive reality – "I" realm}}
Practice: {{c15::{{c1::Introspection}} – {{c2::5 elements paradigm}} is helpful}}
Event(s): {{c16::{{c4::"Knowing"}}, {{c5::awareness found within reactivity}}}}
Major Wisdom: {{c17::{{c6::No escape}}}}
(from https://web.archive.org/web/20201111225017/http://awakenetwork.org/magazine/shargrol/253)

Nature of Problem: {{c14::No Solution}}
Practice: {{c15::{{c1::All of above}}/{{c2::No practice}} – {{c3::reconciling emptiness and form}}}}
Event(s): {{c16::{{c4::Awakening 1}} – {{c5::reality doesn't hide}}, {{c6::yang}}}}
Major Wisdom: {{c17::{{c7::Mind nature}}, {{c8::no being}} ({{c9::nor non-being})}}}}
(from https://web.archive.org/web/20201111225017/http://awakenetwork.org/magazine/shargrol/253)

Nature of Problem: {{c14::No Problem}}
Practice: {{c15::All of above/{{c2::No practice}} – {{c3::reconciling self and other}}}}
Event(s): {{c16::Awakening 2 – {{c5::natural love}}, {{c6::reality as beloved}}, {{c7::yin}}}}
Major Wisdom: {{c17::{{c8::Heart nature}}}}
(from https://web.archive.org/web/20201111225017/http://awakenetwork.org/magazine/shargrol/253)

Nature of Problem: {{c14::No thing}}
Practice: {{c15::{{c1::Spontaneity}}, {{c2::success}} and {{c3::failure}} to live from {{c4::Awakening 1 & 2}}}}
Event(s): {{c16::{{c5::Awakening 3}} – {{c6::reconciling of interior and exterior}}, {{c7::void}}}}
Major Wisdom: {{c17::{{c8::Gut nature}}, {{c9::No interiority}} (remember, our gut is actually on the {{c10::outside}} of our body – we're a {{c11::donut}}, not a {{c12::sphere})}}}}
(from https://web.archive.org/web/20201111225017/http://awakenetwork.org/magazine/shargrol/253)

"{{c15::Fear}} really wants {{c1::to keep us {{c2::safe}}}}.
{{c16::Misery}} really wants {{c3::{{c5::the world}} to be {{c6::more}} {{c4::fair and just}}}}.
{{c17::Disgust}} really wants {{c7::us to {{c8::make {{c11::better}} choices}} and {{c9::care for {{c10::ourselves}}}}}}.
{{c18::Desire for Deliverance}} really wants {{c12::us to {{c13::work carefully}} toward {{c14::improving}}}}."
(shargrol compilation)

Vipassina “Nana/Jhana” (Folk/Ingram) model

Always the question: be with “{{c255::the problem}}” or {{c257::apply a {{c256::method}}}}? I say {{c258::tend toward}} {{c260::being with {{c259::the problem}}}}, {{c261::unless}} a method {{c262::speaks to us}}.
Always the question: is progress stage like, cycle like, fractal, or muiltidimensional? I say tend to think of it as multidimensional, nothing is {{c263::without consequence}}, nothing is {{c264::wasted}}, “progress” is actually beyond mapping
